Message.Title: The new HTML5 Firefox OS ecosystem.
Message.Msg: Mozilla's Firefox OS, the new open mobile ecosystem is a real threat to Android and iOS, currently there are more than 17 key operators spanning the globe committed to that mobile ecosystem. With current US sequester and the global recession, I think the future will be for that free open ecosystem from Mozilla foundation, taking into consideration how it's easy to build applications in HTML5 which is the default standard in many new web browsers.

Message.Title: About to Double Fast, Must Read
Message.Msg: Concurrent (CCUR) gained past 5 days straight, could explode today and double short-term. Virgin Media (VMED) a $23 billion company (largest cable TV company in UK) just announced they deploying CCUR's MediaHawk technology to power their Virgin TV Anywhere platform so that their 3.8mm subscribers can watch on demand videos from any location on their tablets and smartphones. CCUR's EPS last quarter was double the quarter before and quadruple two quarters ago. CCUR sitting on $24.6mm in cash and has no debt, enterprise value of only $43.57mm or just 0.7x their revenue of $62.59mm. CCUR's main rival Seachange (SEAC) has lower margins and is losing money yet it's being valued with enterprise value of 1.8x revenue, which would value CCUR over $15 per share. CCUR could double to $15 very rapidly over the next week!

Message.Title: No matter what the market does GOOG, AAPL and BIDU will lose less than the overall market.
Message.Msg: I know that sounds a little silly , but you need to know how the flow of money continues in these stocks and their bottom line. They all have a unique market. They will make money no matter whatever the market does. Bottom line is, if the market takes a tumble these three stocks will lose less and recover sooner than the other stocks in any portfolio. P.S. If you can't take the heat get out. There will be a correction. Don't gamble with more than you can to lose. Think Cyprus, Bidu, AAPL and many others. It's a #$%$ shoot.
